H0.text: Conclusion is what a hypothesis that is successfully tested many times may become.

H1.text: A theory is a hypothesis that is successfully tested many times.

H2.text: Constant is what a hypothesis that has been successfully tested many times may become.

H3.text: Law is a hypothesis that has been successfully tested many times.

A4.text: Once all of the criteria have been met, it will be widely accepted by scientists (see scientific consensus) as the best available explanation of at least some phenomena.

A5.text: Careful, repeated experiments have both confirmed Einstein's postulates are valid and that the predictions of the special theory of relativity match experiment.
